sections.title: General
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: Do the published documents include financial statements?
items.original_question: Are the financial statements identified clearly and distinguished from other information in the same published document?

decision_tree.question: Do the published documents include financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Inspect the full published document (e.g., annual report or interim financial report). Check for sections titled 'financial statements' or those containing primary financial statements (e.g., balance sheet, statement of comprehensive income, etc.).

yes_case.question: Are the financial statements clearly identified as such and distinguished from other information?
yes_case.guidance: Ensure clear labeling, headings, or introductory notes that distinguish the financial statements from other sections like management commentary, press releases, or supplementary schedules. Look for explicit mentions such as 'Financial Statements' or similar titles.

items.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements for the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity present a statement (or statements) of financial performance for the reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements for the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Check whether the entity has completed financial statements for the reporting period, either as part of its statutory requirements or voluntarily. If no financial statements exist, this checklist item is not applicable.

yes_case.question: Does the financial statement include a statement (or statements) of financial performance?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statements provided by the entity. A statement of financial performance includes the profit or loss for the reporting period and, if applicable, other comprehensive income. Common headings include 'Income Statement', 'Statement of Comprehensive Income', or similar titles. Ensure this is prepared as per IFRS requirements.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
items.original_question: Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the general purpose financial statements and verify that the entity claims compliance with IFRS standards. Check the 'Basis of Preparation' section in the financial statements for wording regarding IFRS compliance.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Review the contents of the financial statements. The statement of financial position should show assets, liabilities, and equity as at the end of the reporting period. Confirm that the statement aligns with IFRS 1.10 requirements for a complete set of financial statements.

items.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements for the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity present a statement of changes in equity for the reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements for the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the submitted financial statements documentation to identify if the entity has prepared and included financial statements for the reporting period as required by IFRS. Ensure you check for completeness, such as consolidated or standalone financial statements, depending on the entity's structure.

yes_case.question: Does the entity include a statement of changes in equity within the financial statements for the reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements and specifically look for the statement of changes in equity. This document should reflect equity movement, such as share capital, reserves, and retained earnings. Check compliance with IFRS 18.10, ensuring it aligns with prescribed formats and details. Pay attention to errors like omission or insufficient details on equity movements.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
items.original_question: Does the entity present a statement of cash flows for the reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Verify whether the entity applies IFRS standards for its financial reporting. Review the accounting policies section of the financial statements and confirm IFRS adoption. Common standards referenced should include IFRS 1 for first-time adoption or general references to IFRS application.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present a statement of cash flows for the reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statements and confirm the inclusion of the Statement of Cash Flows. This is one of the required primary financial statements according to IAS 1. Ensure the statement covers the reporting period and adheres to the format guidelines stipulated by IAS 7.

items.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements for the reporting period in accordance with IFRS?
items.original_question: Does the entity present notes for the reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements for the reporting period in accordance with IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Verify whether the entity has prepared a complete set of financial statements complying with IFRS standards. This includes the statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, statement of changes in equity, statement of cash flows, and accompanying notes as outlined in IAS 1 Presentation of Financial Statements.

yes_case.question: Do the financial statements include comprehensive notes accompanying the primary reports for the reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statements and confirm that a detailed section of notes is included. These notes should provide necessary disclosures, explanations, and details supporting the financial statements in accordance with IFRS requirements, such as accounting policies, breakdowns, and additional context.

items.question: Does the financial statement include items that require disclosure as per IFRS 18?
items.original_question: Does the entity provide comparative information in respect of the preceding period as specified in IFRS 18.31–32?

decision_tree.question: Does the financial statement include items that require disclosure as per IFRS 18?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statement and IFRS 18 guidelines to determine whether the entity's transactions or financial items fall under the scope of IFRS 18 (Revenue). Common examples include contracts with customers for goods, services, or sales transactions. Verify that IFRS 18 applies.

yes_case.question: Has the entity provided comparative information for the preceding period for all disclosures required under IFRS 18?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statement's disclosure section, especially areas related to revenue recognition, contract balances, and performance obligations. Ensure comparative figures for the prior period are present for all applicable disclosures as mandated by paragraphs 31–32 of IFRS 18.

items.question: Has the entity applied an accounting policy retrospectively, made a retrospective restatement, or reclassified items in the financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the beginning of the preceding period if required by IFRS 18.37?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity applied an accounting policy retrospectively, made a retrospective restatement, or reclassified items in the financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements and accounting policies section. Look for disclosures indicating changes in accounting policies, corrections of errors, or reclassifications in the financial statements. Examine the impact on prior periods. If there is no retrospective application, restatement, or reclassification, this checklist item is not applicable.

yes_case.question: Does the retrospective application, restatement, or reclassification have a material effect on the information in the statement of financial position at the beginning of the preceding period?
yes_case.guidance: Evaluate the quantitative and qualitative materiality of the changes. Review prior period amounts and determine if there are significant changes in values that would require presenting a third statement of financial position as per IFRS 18.37.

yes_case.question: Has the entity presented a statement of financial position as at the beginning of the preceding period alongside the current and comparative period statements?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements to ensure that a third statement of financial position is provided, titled 'Statement of Financial Position as at the Beginning of the Preceding Period'. This should accompany the current period and the comparative period as required by IFRS 18.37.

items.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements in accordance with IFRS standards?
items.original_question: Does the entity clearly identify each primary financial statement and the notes?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity prepared financial statements in accordance with IFRS standards?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements. Confirm whether they are prepared under IFRS by checking the accounting policies note and the basis of presentation. Common pitfalls include unclear or conflicting references to other accounting standards.

yes_case.question: Does the entity include all required primary financial statements as specified by IAS 1 (e.g., Statement of Financial Position, Statement of Profit or Loss and Other Comprehensive Income, Statement of Changes in Equity, Statement of Cash Flows)?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements to confirm that all primary statements required by IAS 1 are present. Verify that no essential statements are missing and check against IAS 1 paragraphs 10 and 11 for required statements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity clearly identify each primary financial statement and the notes?
yes_case.guidance: Review whether each primary financial statement is labeled clearly (e.g., 'Statement of Financial Position as at [date]', 'Statement of Profit or Loss for the year ended [date]'). Check whether notes are clearly referenced and numbered, ensuring users can easily cross-reference statements to explanatory notes.

items.question: Has the reporting entity changed its name or any means of identification since the end of the preceding reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose prominently the name of the reporting entity or other means of identification, and any change in that information from the end of the preceding reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Has the reporting entity changed its name or any means of identification since the end of the preceding reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's official documents, such as incorporation certificates, annual reports, or other governance materials. Pay attention to changes such as rebranding, legal name alterations, or updates to identification methods. Compare records from the preceding reporting period to the current one.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed prominently the updated name or means of identification in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Check the cover page, notes to the financial statements, and any introductory sections of the financial statements. The disclosure should be clear and easily noticeable. Ensure it aligns with paragraph IFRS 18.27 and IAS 21.8.

no_case.question: Does the financial statement prominently disclose the name or means of identification of the reporting entity in general?
no_case.guidance: Verify that the entity’s name or other identifiers (such as registration number) are clearly and prominently disclosed in the financial statements. This information should be consistent across different sections such as the cover page and accompanying notes. Reference IFRS 18.27 for specific requirements.

items.question: Are the financial statements prepared by the entity intended to represent either an individual entity or a group of entities?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose prominently whether the financial statements are of an individual entity or a group of entities?

decision_tree.question: Are the financial statements prepared by the entity intended to represent either an individual entity or a group of entities?
decision_tree.guidance: Examine the title or introductory notes of the financial statements and verify whether they describe the context explicitly. Financial statements of a single entity should clearly distinguish from group financial statements, which typically include subsidiaries or other components.

yes_case.question: Does the entity prominently disclose whether the financial statements represent an individual entity or a group of entities?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statements, including the cover page and introductory sections, for a clear and prominent disclosure that specifies if the financial statements pertain to an individual entity or a group (e.g., consolidated financial statements). Ensure the disclosure is presented in a way that is easily identifiable.

items.question: Do the financial statements exist for the entity for the reporting period in question?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose prominently the date of the end of the reporting period or the period covered by the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Do the financial statements exist for the entity for the reporting period in question?
decision_tree.guidance: Verify that the entity has prepared financial statements for the reporting period. Check the financial statement package, including the balance sheet, income statement, and any accompanying notes.

yes_case.question: Do the financial statements include a disclosure of the date of the end of the reporting period or the period covered?
yes_case.guidance: Review the cover page, title, or header of the financial statements, and check for explicit disclosure of the reporting period end date (e.g., 'Year ended December 31, 2023') in accordance with IFRS 18.27 and IAS 21.8. This is typically found in the introductory pages or notes to the financial statements. Confirm the inclusion and proper prominence of this information.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements that involve foreign currency transactions or balances?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose prominently the presentation currency, as defined in IAS 21 The Effects of Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements that involve foreign currency transactions or balances?
decision_tree.guidance: Examine the financial statements for any indication of foreign currency transactions, balances, or foreign subsidiaries. Review the entity's trial balance and notes to the accounts for mentions of foreign currencies.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose its presentation currency prominently in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements, particularly the notes section or the accounting policies section. The presentation currency should be clearly defined and be easily identifiable (e.g., 'The financial statements are presented in USD'). It must also comply with IAS 21 requirements.

items.question: Do the financial statements include numerical amounts?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose prominently the level of rounding used for the amounts in the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Do the financial statements include numerical amounts?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the financial statements, including primary statements (e.g., Statement of Profit or Loss, Statement of Financial Position) and notes. If no numerical amounts are presented, the checklist item is not applicable.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose prominently the level of rounding used for the amounts in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statements for disclosures regarding rounding policies. This may appear in the 'Basis of Preparation' section or within the notes. Common examples of rounding levels include 'nearest thousand' or 'nearest million'. Ensure the rounding disclosure is clear and prominently displayed.

items.question: Has the entity disclosed its domicile, legal form, country of incorporation, and address of its registered office (or principal place of business) elsewhere in the financial statements?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes the domicile and legal form of the entity, its country of incorporation and the address of its registered office (or principal place of business)?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity disclosed its domicile, legal form, country of incorporation, and address of its registered office (or principal place of business) elsewhere in the financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements comprehensively, including sections such as the general information or other relevant notes. Common locations include the introductory section or entity-specific disclosures. Ensure all required attributes (domicile, legal form, country of incorporation, registered address/principal place) are explicitly disclosed. If any are missing in these sections, the item hasn't been disclosed elsewhere.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose its domicile, legal form, country of incorporation, and address of its registered office (or principal place of business) in the notes to the financial statements?
no_case.guidance: Review the notes section thoroughly for the required disclosures as per IFRS 18.116. Check for completeness and accuracy of all attributes: domicile, legal form, country of incorporation, and registered office/principal place of business. Ensure consistency with other sections of the financial statements, and confirm compliance with regulatory terminology where applicable.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS standards?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes a description of the nature of the entity's operations and its principal activities?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS standards?
decision_tree.guidance: Verify if the entity's financial statements explicitly state compliance with IFRS standards, typically in the Basis of Preparation section. Avoid assuming compliance unless explicitly stated.

yes_case.question: Do the financial statements or accompanying notes disclose a description of the nature of the entity's operations and principal activities?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements for a section that describes the entity's business model, industry, and significant activities. Typically, this is provided under the 'General Information' or 'Nature of Operations' heading. Cross-check to ensure it reflects current operations accurately.

no_case.question: Is this information disclosed elsewhere in publicly available documents such as the annual report?
no_case.guidance: Review any supplementary materials, such as the annual report or regulatory filings, for a description of the nature of operations and principal activities. Ensure these documents are publicly accessible and clearly linked to the entity's financial statements.

items.question: Is the entity part of a group with a parent entity and an ultimate parent entity?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes the name of the parent and the ultimate parent of the group?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity part of a group with a parent entity and an ultimate parent entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's organizational structure and ownership details. Check corporate registries, group charts, or legal documentation to confirm if the entity is part of a group that has a parent and an ultimate parent entity. If it is a standalone entity, answer 'No'.

yes_case.question: Is the name of the parent and the ultimate parent disclosed elsewhere in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Search the financial statements, particularly sections such as the general entity details, organizational structure, or related party disclosures. Verify that the names of both the immediate parent and the ultimate parent (if they exist) are mentioned.

no_case.question: Are the names of the parent and the ultimate parent disclosed in the notes to the financial statements?
no_case.guidance: Review the notes section of the financial statements carefully for any disclosures regarding the parent and ultimate parent entity. If not disclosed elsewhere, IFRS 18.116 requires such information to be disclosed explicitly in the notes.

items.question: Does the entity qualify as a limited-life entity under IFRS 18?
items.original_question: If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes information regarding the length of life if it is a limited-life entity?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity qualify as a limited-life entity under IFRS 18?
decision_tree.guidance: A limited-life entity is one that has a predefined or contractual duration of existence. Review the entity’s foundational legal documents or agreements (e.g., articles of incorporation, partnership agreements). Look for language specifying a termination date or limited duration.

yes_case.question: Has the length of life been disclosed elsewhere in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Check all sections of the financial statements, such as summary notes, significant accounting policies, or other relevant disclosures. Ensure the information regarding the entity's limited life is clearly stated.

no_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the length of life in the notes accompanying the financial statements?
no_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements specifically for measurements or explanations about the predefined life of the entity. The disclosure should include explicit language about the contractual or predefined duration.

items.question: Does the entity have transactions, events, or conditions that could impact its financial position and performance?
items.original_question: Does the entity provide additional disclosures when compliance with IFRS is insufficient to enable users to understand the impact of transactions, events, and conditions on its financial position and performance?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have transactions, events, or conditions that could impact its financial position and performance?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements, notes, and disclosures for details on transactions, events, or conditions that affect its financial position and performance. Examples include significant business combinations, changes in accounting policies, major impairments, and unusual transactions. Refer to IFRS 18 and IAS 8.6A for guidance on identifying these items.

yes_case.question: Have the disclosures provided been sufficient to enable users to understand the impact of these transactions, events, or conditions on the entity's financial position and performance?
yes_case.guidance: Assess the disclosures provided in the notes to the financial statements. Ensure that the information presented clarifies the financial impact and performance implications of the transactions, events, or conditions. Check against IFRS 18.113 and IAS 8.6C for adequacy. Look specifically for omissions or vague descriptions.

no_case.question: Has the entity properly considered additional disclosures when the initial disclosures were deemed insufficient?
no_case.guidance: Examine whether the entity has addressed insufficient disclosures by providing additional details as required under IAS 8.6A and IFRS 18. Consider the adequacy and relevance of these additional disclosures in describing the financial impact and performance. Common pitfalls include boilerplate language and incomplete explanations.

items.question: Has the entity prepared its financial statements in accordance with IFRS Accounting Standards?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose an explicit and unreserved statement of compliance with IFRS Accounting Standards?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity prepared its financial statements in accordance with IFRS Accounting Standards?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the front sections of the annual report, including the basis of preparation note in the financial statements. Look for statements explicitly mentioning compliance with IFRS Accounting Standards, as issued by the IASB. Common errors include claiming compliance with IFRS but also adhering to local GAAP that overrides IFRS requirements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose an explicit and unreserved statement of compliance with IFRS Accounting Standards in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements, particularly the basis of preparation section. Ensure the statement uses clear language, such as 'The financial statements comply with IFRS Accounting Standards as issued by the IASB', without any reservations or qualifications.

items.question: Has management made an explicit statement in the financial statements regarding fair presentation of the entity's financial position, performance, and cash flows?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose that management concluded the financial statements present fairly the entity's financial position, performance and cash flows?

decision_tree.question: Has management made an explicit statement in the financial statements regarding fair presentation of the entity's financial position, performance, and cash flows?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the Notes to the Financial Statements or the Statement of Financial Position. Check IAS 1.15–IAS 1.19 for requirements on fair presentation. Look for an explicit assertion that the financial statements comply with IFRS and fairly represent the entity’s financial position, performance, and cash flows. Pay attention to any qualifying statements, as these may indicate non-compliance.

yes_case.question: Does the disclosure comply with IAS 8, ensuring no deviations from IFRS unless clearly stipulated by necessity?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the disclosure for any indications of non-compliance with IFRS. Refer to IAS 8.6E–IAS 8.6F for further details on departures from IFRS. Deviations should only occur under rare circumstances and must be justified sufficiently in the financial statements.

items.question: Does the entity prepare its financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose that it has complied with applicable IFRSs, except where it departed to achieve a fair presentation?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare its financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements, particularly the accounting policies section and the auditor's report, to confirm they state compliance with IFRS. Ensure there are references to IFRS standards applied explicitly in the documents. Watch for statements indicating partial compliance or the use of other reporting frameworks.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed any departures from IFRS standards in its financial statements to achieve a fair presentation?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements for explicit disclosures of any departures from IFRS standards. Look for reasons stated for the departures, ensuring they aim to achieve a fair presentation. Verify that the departures are justified as per IAS 8.6E and IAS 8.6F.

yes_case.question: Has the entity sufficiently disclosed the nature, financial impact, and rationale for each departure to ensure users understand the adjustments made for fair presentation?
yes_case.guidance: Ensure the disclosure explains why the departure was necessary for fair presentation, the standards departed from, and the financial impact of the adjustments made. Review the related notes and cross-reference with IAS 8.6E and IAS 8.6F requirements. Confirm that the rationale aligns with the objective of financial statement fair presentation.

items.question: Has the entity departed from any IFRS in preparing its financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS from which it has departed?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from any IFRS in preparing its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and accounting policies. Analyze disclosures for any indication that the entity has not complied with specific IFRS requirements. Look at notes to the accounts or auditor reports for mention of exceptions.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the title of the IFRS from which it has departed?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the disclosures in the financial statements. Specifically, check for a clear mention of the IFRS title(s) under departure. Ensure the reference to IFRS is explicit and not vague. Cross-check Section IAS 8.6E and IAS 8.6F for guidelines.

items.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement, as described in IAS 8.6E or IAS 8.6F?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the nature of the departure?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from an IFRS requirement, as described in IAS 8.6E or IAS 8.6F?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and disclosures. Look for explicit mentions of non-compliance with any IFRS requirement, including specific departures that are justified due to exceptional circumstances or to achieve a fair presentation. Confirm the rationale and documentation supporting the departure.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the departure, including the IFRS requirement from which it departed?
yes_case.guidance: Check whether the disclosure provides detailed information, including the nature of the departure, the specific standard(s) involved, and the reason for the departure. This information should be clearly stated in the notes to the financial statements.

items.question: Is the entity applying an IFRS for the preparation of its financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the treatment that the IFRS would require?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity applying an IFRS for the preparation of its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the accounting policies section within the financial statements and verify if the entity explicitly adheres to International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS). This information is typically disclosed in Note 1 of the financial statements. Ensure there is no ambiguity or conflict between stated compliance and reported standards.

yes_case.question: Does the financial statement include an explicit disclosure explaining the treatment required by the relevant IFRS for the impacted transaction or item?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements where the entity should explain how it applies the required IFRS treatment for significant transactions or items. Look for clear references to applicable IFRS provisions, such as IAS 8.6E and IAS 8.6F. Avoid vague or non-specific wording.

yes_case.question: Is the disclosure sufficiently detailed and in compliance with the guidance outlined in IAS 8.6E and IAS 8.6F?
yes_case.guidance: Evaluate the disclosure for clarity and adequacy. Ensure that the entity explains why the selected treatment aligns with IFRS requirements. The disclosure should include references to the specific paragraph in the IFRS standard applicable and described reasoning. Insufficient detail or lack of specificity raises a compliance issue.

items.question: Has the entity applied an accounting policy that deviates from the IFRS requirements?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the reason why that treatment would be misleading?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity applied an accounting policy that deviates from the IFRS requirements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and compare the accounting policies applied with IFRS standards (IAS 8, paragraphs 6E & 6F). Check if it has deliberately chosen a policy different from IFRS due to the belief that compliance would mislead financial statement users. Examples include selecting a non-standard measurement basis or presentation policy.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the accounting policy it has applied instead of the IFRS requirement?
yes_case.guidance: Check the accounting policies note in the entity's financial statements for explicit mention of the alternative treatment. Ensure the disclosure specifies the applied policy and how it differs from IFRS. Refer to IAS 8.6E and IAS 8.6F for detailed disclosure requirements.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reason why following IFRS would be misleading?
yes_case.guidance: Review IAS 8.6E and IAS 8.6F for guidance on acceptable reasoning. Validate the explanation provided in the notes to the financial statements, ensuring it addresses how compliance with IFRS would result in information that is less relevant or would distort understanding.

items.question: Has the entity adopted a specific accounting treatment that requires disclosure under IAS 8?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the treatment adopted?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity adopted a specific accounting treatment that requires disclosure under IAS 8?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the accounting policies section of the financial statements and the relevant notes. Look for changes in accounting policies, estimation methods, or corrections of prior period errors as per IAS 8. Common areas include revenue recognition, depreciation methods, or inventory valuation. Ensure that all material decisions requiring disclosure are identified.

yes_case.question: Does the entity clearly disclose the treatment adopted in accordance with IAS 8?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements and accompanying notes for clear and detailed disclosure. Ensure the entity describes the accounting treatment adopted, the rationale for its adoption, and how it aligns with IAS 8. Pay special attention to comparability of information provided and consistency of disclosure across reporting periods.

items.question: Has the entity departed from a requirement of an IFRS standard in preparing its financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose, for each period presented, the financial effect of the departure on each item in the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity departed from a requirement of an IFRS standard in preparing its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and accompanying notes for any explicit departures from IFRS requirements. Departure occurs when the entity does not apply a prescribed IFRS standard due to specific circumstances, often justified by management. Common pitfalls: Ensure departures are clearly documented and not mistaken for accounting estimates or interpretations.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the financial effect of the departure on each item in the financial statements for each period presented?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements for details on all impacted items (e.g., asset values, liabilities, income, expenses) resulting from the IFRS departure. Ensure disclosures are itemized by financial statement line item and cover all relevant reporting periods. Cross-reference with IAS 8.6E and IAS 8.6F for specific disclosure requirements.

items.question: Has the entity made a prior-period departure from an IFRS?
items.original_question: If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS from which it departed?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made a prior-period departure from an IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Review prior-period financial statements and documentation of accounting policies to determine if the entity explicitly disclosed that it did not comply with an IFRS standard in the prior period, as per IAS 8. Paragraphs 6F and 6G. Look for statements of departure and supporting notes.

yes_case.question: Does the prior-period departure impact current-period amounts?
yes_case.guidance: Assess the financial impact of the prior-period departure on the current-period balances. Identify areas where prior decisions have carried forward effects—for example, adjustments to asset values, liabilities, or equity. Refer to IAS 8.6F and IAS 8.6G for specific guidance.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the title of the IFRS from which it departed?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosures in the financial statements for explicit mentions of the departed IFRS standard. Ensure the disclosure provides the title of the standard and clarifies the nature of the departure.

items.question: Did the entity depart from IFRS requirements in prior periods that affect current amounts?
items.original_question: If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the nature of the departure?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity depart from IFRS requirements in prior periods that affect current amounts?
decision_tree.guidance: Review prior-period financial statements and disclosures. Look for any departures from IFRS requirements as described in IAS 8.6G or IAS 8.6F. Cross-check with the current period's financial statements to assess if the prior-period departure has impacted current amounts.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the prior-period departure and its effect on current amounts?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements. Specifically, ensure disclosures explain the nature of the departure, why the entity believes the IFRS departure provides relevant information, and quantify its effect on current period amounts.

items.question: Has the entity made a departure from IFRS in a prior period?
items.original_question: If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the treatment the IFRS would require?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made a departure from IFRS in a prior period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review prior-period financial statements and assess whether the entity deviated from IFRS requirements in any material item. Look for notes explaining exceptions or departures. Confirm if these departures are clearly documented.

yes_case.question: Does the prior-period departure affect amounts reported in the current period?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements for current-period adjustments or restatements linked to the prior-period departure. Review disclosures in the notes regarding changes arising from such departures.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the treatment required by the IFRS for the affected area?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements for an explanation of how IFRS rules would have been applied had there been no departure, as required under IAS 8.6F and IAS 8.6G. Ensure this explanation includes sufficient detail to allow users to understand the financial impact.

items.question: Did the entity make a departure from an IFRS standard in a prior period?
items.original_question: If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the reason why that treatment would be misleading?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity make a departure from an IFRS standard in a prior period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the accounting policies and disclosures for any explicitly stated departures from IFRS standards in prior periods. Check supporting notes in the financial statements for mentions of non-conformity with IFRS. Departures are rare and typically justified as necessary to achieve a fair presentation.

yes_case.question: Does the prior-period departure affect current amounts in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Analyze whether the prior-period departure impacts current period amounts directly or indirectly (e.g., adjustments or carry-forwards). Review comparative amounts provided in the current period's financial statements for any traceable impact from the prior period.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reason why the earlier IFRS treatment would have been misleading?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements. Look for explicit explanations justifying why compliance with the specific IFRS standard for the prior period would have resulted in misleading financial information, and why the departure was necessary.

items.question: Did the entity have a departure from IFRS in a prior period that affects the current period's reported amounts?
items.original_question: If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the treatment adopted?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity have a departure from IFRS in a prior period that affects the current period's reported amounts?
decision_tree.guidance: Review historical financial statements and the accounting policies section for indications of any stated departures from IFRS in prior periods. Verify whether any such departures have implications for current-period amounts or disclosures. Common pitfalls include failing to identify prior departures that have ongoing effects or misinterpreting their relevance.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the treatment adopted to address the prior-period departure affecting current-period amounts?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to the notes to the financial statements, particularly the disclosure section relevant to accounting policies and changes. Ensure the entity has clearly explained how the prior departure has been addressed in the current period, including impacts on measurements, recognition, or disclosures.

items.question: Did the entity have a prior-period departure from an accounting policy that impacts current period amounts?
items.original_question: If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the financial effect on each item for each period presented?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity have a prior-period departure from an accounting policy that impacts current period amounts?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and notes for any disclosed changes in accounting policies that deviate from previous periods. Pay particular attention to IAS 8 (Accounting Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors), and check whether the departure affects current amounts disclosed.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the financial effect of the prior-period departure on each affected item for each period presented?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements. Specifically, ensure that the impact of the prior-period departure is quantified and presented on all affected items for each relevant comparative period, as required by IAS 8. Look for missing disclosures or unexplained differences in amounts.

items.question: Has the entity identified a situation where compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading?
items.original_question: If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS in question?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity identified a situation where compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity’s financial statements and assess whether any specific IFRS requirement leads to an outcome that misrepresents the financial position, cash flows, or performance. This situation is rare and must be supported by clear, justified rationale. Refer to IAS 8.6 for guidance on such cases.

yes_case.question: Has the entity determined that it is prohibited from departing from the IFRS requirement under local regulations or other legal constraints?
yes_case.guidance: Evaluate applicable local laws, regulations, or other governing frameworks to confirm if there is a legal restriction preventing the departure from the specific IFRS requirement. Ensure this assessment is documented.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS in question in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements. The disclosure must explicitly mention the title of the IFRS standard that would lead to misleading compliance and explain the situation thoroughly.

items.question: Does the entity identify any IFRS requirement whose compliance would be misleading and contradict the objective of fair presentation in its financial statements?
items.original_question: If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the nature of the requirement?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity identify any IFRS requirement whose compliance would be misleading and contradict the objective of fair presentation in its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial reporting framework applied by the entity, including the notes to the financial statements. Pay close attention to situations where strict compliance with IFRS principles might distort the substance of financial information, leading to misleading conclusions about the entity’s financial position or performance. Refer to IAS 1.15-1.17 for guidance on fair presentation principles.

yes_case.question: Is departure from the IFRS requirement explicitly prohibited under the standards or relevant jurisdictional regulation?
yes_case.guidance: Verify IFRS legal requirements, specific local legislation, and regulatory guidance. Consider if the entity is unable to deviate from the requirement due to binding legal provisions. Refer to IAS 8.6 for exemption rules and constraints related to misleading compliance scenarios.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the IFRS requirement and why compliance would be misleading?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statement disclosures, including the notes section, for relevant explanations. Disclosure must include the nature of the IFRS requirement, details on how compliance would conflict with fair presentation, and potentially alternative treatments considered by the entity.

items.question: Has the entity identified a situation where compliance with IFRS requirements would result in misleading financial statements?
items.original_question: If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the reason why complying is misleading?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity identified a situation where compliance with IFRS requirements would result in misleading financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial reporting process and decisions. Specifically, ensure any deviation has been justified with evidence that strict compliance could mislead stakeholders. Misleading compliance often involves material misrepresentation, omission, or confusion. Check significant judgments documented by the entity's management in their accounting policies.

yes_case.question: Has the entity refrained from departing from an IFRS requirement due to prohibition?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the relevant IFRS standards applied to the financial statements and verify whether IFRS explicitly prohibits deviations from any of its provisions due to potential misleading effects. Look for references in IAS 8 Paragraph 6 or related prohibitions within the applicable standard.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the reason why complying with IFRS requirements is misleading?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements and disclosures. IAS 8 Paragraph 6 requires the entity to explain why compliance leads to misleading financial results and provide the rationale for the decisions made. Ensure the disclosure is clear and addresses stakeholders' need for transparency.

items.question: Has the entity identified that compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading and departure from the requirement is prohibited?
items.original_question: If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose, for each period, the adjustments that would be necessary for a fair presentation?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity identified that compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading and departure from the requirement is prohibited?
decision_tree.guidance: Check for documented evidence in the financial statements or internal discussions regarding scenarios where compliance with an IFRS would lead to misleading results. Focus on IAS 8.6I compliance guidance, which requires substantive justification for departure. Avoid assuming 'misleading' without clear documentation of material impact.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed, for each reporting period, the adjustments necessary for a fair presentation, as required by IAS 8.6I?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosure notes in the financial statements of all relevant periods. Look for a detailed explanation of adjustments that would have been needed for a fair presentation, including quantitative and qualitative details. Ensure the disclosures are clear and specific.

items.question: Is the entity experiencing financial or operational difficulties that may cast doubt on its ability to continue as a going concern?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose material uncertainties that may cast significant doubt on its ability to continue as a going concern?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity experiencing financial or operational difficulties that may cast doubt on its ability to continue as a going concern?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements, including the balance sheet, cash flow statement, and income statement for signs of financial distress (e.g., recurring losses, negative net assets, liquidity issues). Check auditor comments or board minutes that discuss operational challenges or risks.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed material uncertainties related to its ability to continue as a going concern in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements, particularly sections discussing risks, contingencies, or going concern assessment. Material uncertainties often include liquidity risks, debt nearing maturity without refinancing arrangements, or significant operational disruptions.

items.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
items.original_question: If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose that fact?

decision_tree.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the accounting policies note in the financial statements and any auditor’s reports or disclosures regarding liquidity concerns, management plans, or uncertainty. The going concern assumption applies unless management either intends to liquidate the entity or cease trading, or has no realistic alternative but to do so.

no_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the fact that the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis?
no_case.guidance: Check the financial statements’ notes for explicit disclosure stating that the financial statements were not prepared on a going concern basis. Focus on the summary of significant accounting policies and any explanatory notes addressing the reasoning.

items.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
items.original_question: If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the basis on which they are prepared?

decision_tree.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and management representation letter. Look for explicit or implicit statements confirming that the entity assumes continuing operations for the foreseeable future. Be vigilant for indications of financial distress, e.g., recurring losses, negative cash flows, or balance sheet insolvency, which might suggest otherwise.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose the basis on which the financial statements are prepared in the absence of the going concern assumption?
no_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements and accounting policies section. Verify whether the alternative basis of preparation (e.g., liquidation basis or other) is clearly disclosed, including the rationale for the chosen basis and its implications on measurement and presentation.

items.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
items.original_question: If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the reason why it is not regarded as a going concern?

decision_tree.question: Are the financial statements prepared on a going concern basis?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the basis of preparation section in the financial statements and the accompanying disclosures. A going concern assumption means the entity is expected to continue its operations for the foreseeable future. Check for explicit or implicit statements indicating whether the going concern assumption is applied.

no_case.question: Does the entity disclose the reason why it is not regarded as a going concern?
no_case.guidance: Inspect the financial statements for notes or disclosures explaining why the entity is not regarded as a going concern. Look in the basis of preparation section or any accompanying disclosures that detail financial or operational challenges, such as insolvency or liquidation plans. Ensure the reason is specific and clearly presented.

items.question: Did the entity’s reporting period change to be longer or shorter than one year?
items.original_question: If the reporting period changes and is longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose the reporting period covered by the financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity’s reporting period change to be longer or shorter than one year?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the entity's financial statements, specifically the introductory note or details in the statement of financial position. Refer to the reporting period details disclosed, typically located in the general information section of the financial statements. The standard reporting period is one year; verify whether this period deviates.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the reporting period covered in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements and accompanying notes for explicit disclosure of the reporting period. Pay attention to any sections describing accounting policies or basis of preparation, as these often include reporting period details. Ensure clarity and correctness of the disclosure.

items.question: Has the entity changed its reporting period to be longer or shorter than one year?
items.original_question: If the reporting period changes and is longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose the reason for using a longer or shorter period?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity changed its reporting period to be longer or shorter than one year?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and reporting framework. Check if the current reporting period differs from the standard 12-month period. Look for explicit statements or unusual period lengths disclosed in the notes to financial statements. Common pitfalls include overlooking minor changes or interim period adjustments.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reason for the change in reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Search the notes to the financial statements for a clear explanation of the change in reporting period and its justification. Ensure the disclosure specifies why the reporting period differs from the standard length. Avoid assuming compliance without documented evidence.

items.question: Has the entity's reporting period changed, resulting in a period longer or shorter than one year?
items.original_question: If the reporting period changes and is longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose that amounts are not entirely comparable?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity's reporting period changed, resulting in a period longer or shorter than one year?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the reporting period stated in the financial statements (e.g., the cover page and accounting policies). Compare the duration of the current reporting period with prior periods. Common pitfalls: Ensure to check if this includes fiscal changes, mergers, or adjustments due to external requirements.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed that the amounts in the financial statements are not entirely comparable due to the change in reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes to the financial statements, specifically any disclosures about comparability of amounts. This information is often included in the accounting policies or explanatory notes. Common pitfalls: Ensure the disclosure explicitly addresses the comparability issue rather than just mentioning the reporting period change.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements for a reporting period that is not the first reporting period under IFRS?
items.original_question: Does the entity provide comparative information for the preceding period for all amounts reported in the current statements, except when IFRS permits or requires otherwise?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements for a reporting period that is not the first reporting period under IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the entity's financial reporting history. If the entity is preparing its first set of IFRS financial statements, comparative information may not be required for the preceding period. Review the financial reporting notes or prior period disclosures.

yes_case.question: Does the entity provide comparative information for all amounts reported in the current financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements, specifically the income statement, statement of financial position, and other primary financial statements, as well as related notes. Verify that corresponding amounts for the previous period are presented unless IFRS explicitly permits an exemption.

no_case.question: Does IFRS permit or require the omission of comparative information for any amounts reported in the current financial statements?
no_case.guidance: Refer to specific IFRS standards relevant to the financial statements' line items (e.g., IFRS 1 for first-time adoption or standards like IFRS 15 regarding revenue recognition). Verify that any omitted comparative information complies with these exceptions.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements for the current period in accordance with IFRS?
items.original_question: Does the entity include comparative narrative and descriptive information if necessary to understand the current period's financial statements?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements for the current period in accordance with IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Verify whether the entity’s financial statements are based on IFRS standards. Check the basis of preparation note in the financial statements, which should explicitly state compliance with IFRS.

yes_case.question: Are there narrative or descriptive comparisons to prior periods necessary to understand the current period's financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Evaluate whether significant changes, unusual transactions, or events occurred between periods that might impact the understanding of the financial statements (e.g., changes in accounting policies, major acquisitions). Refer to IFRS 18.31 and IFRS 18.B13 for examples of necessary comparative information.

yes_case.question: Has the entity provided appropriate comparative narrative and descriptive information in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine notes to the financial statements and management commentary for explicit comparative discussion of prior periods. Ensure that the information aligns with IFRS 18 requirements and adds clarity to unusual changes or key transactions.

items.question: Has the entity made any presentation or classification changes in the financial statements during the current period?
items.original_question: If presentation or classification changes, does the entity disclose the nature of the reclassification (including at the beginning of the preceding period)?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made any presentation or classification changes in the financial statements during the current period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and compare them to prior periods. Look for changes in the way items are presented or categorized in the statement of financial position, income statement, or other financial reports. Common examples include reclassification of liabilities or changing the grouping of expenses.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the reclassification, including details at the beginning of the preceding period?
yes_case.guidance: Consult the notes to the financial statements and ensure they provide clear explanations for reclassifications. The disclosure must include the reasons for the change and the impact on prior period comparisons, specifically starting from the beginning of the preceding period. Cross-check the IFRS 18.33 requirements to confirm compliance.

items.question: Has the entity made any presentation or classification changes in the financial statements during the reporting period?
items.original_question: If presentation or classification changes, does the entity disclose the amount of each item or class of items that is reclassified?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made any presentation or classification changes in the financial statements during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements, especially the comparatives. Check the notes and accounting policies for disclosure of any changes in how items or classes of items are presented or classified. Look for terms like 'reclassification', 'revised presentation', or 'new classification'.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the amount for each reclassified item or class of items?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to the notes accompanying the financial statements, particularly those relating to changes in accounting policies or presentation classifications. Verify that each reclassified item or class is disclosed clearly with its corresponding amount. Ensure details reconcile with prior year figures.

items.question: Has the entity made changes to the presentation or classification of items in its financial statements?
items.original_question: If presentation or classification changes, does the entity disclose the reason for the reclassification?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made changes to the presentation or classification of items in its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Examine the financial statements for any deviations from prior periods in how items are presented or classified. Compare current classifications against previous year statements, paying attention to any reported changes in approach or layout.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reason for the reclassification?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements, specifically look for an explanation adjacent to the reclassification adjustments or under the relevant headings in the disclosure sections. Ensure the description is clear and sufficiently explains why the reclassification was made.

items.question: Has the entity undergone any reclassification of comparatives as required by IFRS 18?
items.original_question: If reclassification of comparatives is impracticable, does the entity disclose the reason for not reclassifying the amounts?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity undergone any reclassification of comparatives as required by IFRS 18?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and accompanying notes. Look for any mention of reclassifications of comparative amounts, particularly in accordance with IFRS 18. This might be disclosed in the Accounting Policies section or the notes on changes in presentation.

yes_case.question: Was the reclassification of comparatives impracticable?
yes_case.guidance: To assess ‘impracticability,’ check if the entity explicitly states that they are unable to reconstruct prior-period information due to excessive cost, lack of information, or other legitimate reasons. This explanation should be documented in the notes to the financial statements.

yes_case.question: Did the entity disclose the reason for not reclassifying the amounts in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes where reclassification is mentioned. Ensure the entity provides a clear explanation for why reclassification is impracticable, referencing specific constraints like time, cost, or unavailability of necessary data.

items.question: Is the entity required to reclassify comparatives under IFRS 18.34?
items.original_question: If reclassification comparatives is impracticable, does the entity disclose the nature of the adjustments that would have been made?

decision_tree.question: Is the entity required to reclassify comparatives under IFRS 18.34?
decision_tree.guidance: Determine whether any adjustments or reclassifications of comparative figures are required due to changes in account classifications as per IFRS 18. Review the nature of changes in the accounting policies or reclassification instructions provided by the standard.

yes_case.question: Is it impracticable for the entity to reclassify comparatives as per IFRS 18.34?
yes_case.guidance: Assess whether the reclassification of comparatives cannot be reasonably achieved without undue cost or effort. Review any supporting documentation or explanations provided by the entity, and evaluate whether the claim of impracticability is justified.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the nature of adjustments that would have been made if reclassification was practicable?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements, particularly under disclosures related to accounting policies or the specific note where the change is discussed. Ensure a clear explanation of the adjustments that would have been made but were impracticable is provided.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
items.original_question: Does the entity present the current and preceding period in each primary financial statement and in the notes?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's accounting policies and ensure that the financial statements explicitly state compliance with IFRS, typically found in the 'Basis of Preparation' section of the notes.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present the current period in each primary financial statement and in the notes to the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements, including the Statement of Financial Position, Statement of Profit or Loss and Other Comprehensive Income, Statement of Changes in Equity, Statement of Cash Flows, and notes to the financial statements. Verify the presence of financial information for the current reporting period.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present the preceding period in each primary financial statement and in the notes to the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Ensure that comparative information for the preceding reporting period is provided alongside the current period. Confirm this for all primary financial statements and detailed notes.

items.question: Did the entity voluntarily present additional comparative financial statements beyond the minimum required by IFRS?
items.original_question: When voluntarily presenting additional comparatives, does the entity present related note information for those additional statements?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity voluntarily present additional comparative financial statements beyond the minimum required by IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements provided by the entity. Check if the entity has presented comparative financial statements for periods other than the immediately preceding period (e.g., additional historical years). Refer to IFRS 18.B14 for the requirements on voluntary presentation of comparatives.

yes_case.question: Are the related notes provided for the additional comparative financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the financial statements and cross-reference the notes. Ensure that any additional comparative financial statements provided have corresponding explanatory note disclosures. These notes should provide relevant details consistent with what is disclosed for the primary periods presented.

items.question: Do the circumstances described in IFRS 18.37 apply to the entity?
items.original_question: In the circumstances of IFRS 18.37, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the current period?

decision_tree.question: Do the circumstances described in IFRS 18.37 apply to the entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to IFRS 18.37 in the IFRS standards. Determine whether the entity is required to provide additional financial information due to unusual circumstances, including significant changes or events that could affect stakeholders' understanding of the entity's financial position. Review supporting documents such as contracts, transaction records, or regulatory filings.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the current period?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the statement of financial position within the financial statements. Specifically check the reporting date and ensure it aligns with the end of the current period. Look for omissions or incorrect reporting related to significant events required under IFRS 18.37.

items.question: Do the circumstances described in IFRS 18.37 apply to the entity?
items.original_question: In the circumstances of IFRS 18.37, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the preceding period?

decision_tree.question: Do the circumstances described in IFRS 18.37 apply to the entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to IFRS 18 paragraph 37. These circumstances involve specific reporting requirements, such as retrospective adjustments or the adoption of new accounting standards that affect prior periods. Review the accounting policies and changes disclosed by the entity, and verify whether the entity falls under these conditions.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the preceding period?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements. Specifically, look for the statement of financial position (balance sheet) provided for the end of the prior reporting period. Ensure this is clearly presented as required by IFRS 18.38 in cases where IFRS 18.37 applies.

items.question: Does IFRS 18.37 apply to the entity's financial statements?
items.original_question: In the circumstances of IFRS 18.37, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the beginning of the preceding period?

decision_tree.question: Does IFRS 18.37 apply to the entity's financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Evaluate if the entity's financial statements were affected by retrospective application of a new accounting policy, correction of a prior period error, or retrospective restatement. Refer to IFRS 18.37 for specific circumstances requiring such adjustments.

yes_case.question: Has the entity presented a statement of financial position as at the beginning of the preceding period?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements. Specifically confirm whether three comparative statements of financial position are provided: the end of the current period, the end of the preceding period, and the beginning of the preceding period. This is mandatory under IFRS 18.38 in case IFRS 18.37 circumstances apply.

items.question: Does the entity present a third statement of financial position in its financial statements?
items.original_question: When presenting a third statement of financial position, does the entity disclose the information required by IFRS 18.33–36 and IAS 8?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity present a third statement of financial position in its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements provided by the entity. A third statement of financial position is required when a retrospective change in accounting policies, correction of errors, or reclassification occurs, impacting the opening balances of the earliest comparative period. Refer to IFRS 18.39 and IAS 1.10(f).

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the information required by IFRS 18.33–36 and IAS 8?
yes_case.guidance: Ensure the third statement of financial position includes disclosures about the retrospective application or retrospective restatement, as per IFRS 18.33–36. Verify references to IAS 8 provisions on accounting policies, estimates, and prior period errors. Check if supporting explanations and reconciliations are included.

items.question: Has the entity presented a third statement of financial position in its financial statements?
items.original_question: When presenting a third statement of financial position, is its date the beginning of the preceding period regardless of earlier comparative information?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity presented a third statement of financial position in its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements to determine if a third statement of financial position is included, typically required when retrospective adjustments are applied (e.g., due to changes in accounting policy or error corrections). Check IAS 1.40 for reference to requirements of the third statement.

yes_case.question: Is the date of the third statement of financial position the beginning of the preceding period?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that the date of the third statement of financial position aligns with the beginning of the preceding period (i.e., the start of the prior year). Ensure earlier comparative information does not affect this requirement.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements for more than one reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity retain the presentation of items from one period to the next?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements for more than one reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the financial statements provided by the entity. If the entity has comparative financial information presented (at least two reporting periods), this question is applicable. Review IAS 1, paragraphs 38–45 for requirements regarding comparative information.

yes_case.question: Has the entity retained the presentation and classification of items from one reporting period to the next?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements for consistency in presentation and classification of items (e.g., types of revenue, expenses, assets, liabilities). Ensure changes in presentation or classification are made only when required by a new IFRS standard or if they provide more relevant or reliable information (refer to IAS 1, paragraph 45).

no_case.question: Did the entity provide sufficient disclosure explaining why a change in presentation or classification was made?
no_case.guidance: Verify whether the notes to the financial statements include adequate explanations for changes in presentation or classification. Ensure the entity justifies that the changes provide more relevant or reliable information, or are due to a new or amended IFRS (refer to IAS 1, paragraph 46).

items.question: Has the entity included disclosures for the current reporting period in its financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity retain the disclosure of items from one period to the next?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity included disclosures for the current reporting period in its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements and cross-check with the disclosures required by IFRS 18. Pay attention to the items that must be disclosed under IFRS 18.30. Ensure all disclosures are relevant to the current reporting period as detailed in the checklist.

yes_case.question: Are the disclosed items consistent with those reported in the prior period, ensuring comparability?
yes_case.guidance: Compare the items disclosed in the current reporting period with those from the prior period. Ensure all relevant items are retained and that any changes are fully explained as required under IFRS 18.30. Look for unexplained omissions or inconsistencies.

yes_case.question: Are changes to the disclosed items clearly explained in the financial statements if any deviations occur?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosures for notes explaining any changes in the disclosed items compared to the prior period (e.g., new policies, revised reporting requirements). Verify that these explanations are sufficiently detailed and comply with IFRS 18.30.

items.question: Does the entity have items subject to classification in the financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity retain the classification of items from one period to the next?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have items subject to classification in the financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Examine the financial statements and identify if there are any items that require specific classification (e.g., assets, liabilities, equity, income, expenses). Refer to IFRS 18.30 for classification requirements. If no such items exist, this checklist item is not applicable.

yes_case.question: Has the entity changed the classification of these items from one period to the next?
yes_case.guidance: Check the comparative financial statements over two consecutive reporting periods. Look for any classification changes in the statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss, or statement of changes in equity. Ensure consistent classifications unless specific criteria (e.g., changes in accounting policy, error corrections, or transactions meeting different recognition criteria under IFRS) justify the change.

yes_case.question: Does the change in classification meet the criteria justified under IFRS (e.g., change in accounting policy, correction of error, or change in recognition criteria)?
